primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a life of 'Empire' (production/consumption) to a life of 'Faith' (mercy/pardon) through the disruption of God's word.

tekstueel_bewijs: Why do you spend your money on that which is not bread?
Return to your roots; seek the Lord.
My soul is satisfied as with a rich feast
Fourth Church is a carrier of this stunning poem
Lent is a question, a gift and a summons

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as a socio-economic mindset or 'phoniness' rather than an ontological power like Sin or Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The production of 'fruit' (ethical living) as a result of returning to faith.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon oscillates between fruit being a 'gift' and fruit being a 'task' required to avoid perishing.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: Why do you spend your money?
You who have no money, come buy

voorbeelden: Unless you repent, you will all perish
Who wants us out of the rat-race
If we have better equipment... we can succeed
If it cannot produce figs, cut it down

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses heavily on the obligation (Devoir) to change and the summons to act, assuming the hearer has the power (Pouvoir) if they simply choose to 'return'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Empire) to ~S2 (Free Gifts) to S1 (Mercy), but ending on a Devoir-heavy S1 (Repentance/Fruit).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in 'returning' to a true self that is capable of bearing fruit.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; Empire is seen as a 'seduction' rather than a totalizing bondage.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses the language of 'free gifts' and 'pardon,' the underlying actantial structure is anthropocentric: the human subject must 'seek,' 'return,' and 'bear fruit' to avoid perishing.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Unless you repent, you will all perish.
Do the first fruit of the new life.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is all free! It is all a gift.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Jewish exiles and the fig tree are used as models for the hearer's behavior.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God as the gardener who preserves the tree despite its fruitlessness.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform 'mercy' as a new form of productivity.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God provides the venue, but man must execute the return.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: There is a tension between the 'free gift' and the 'summons to bear fruit or die.'
spanning_punten: The transition from 'free wine' to 'unless you repent you perish'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Lent is a wake-up call... to focus on this mercy.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon assumes the hearer has the innate capacity to 'return' once they are 'woken up'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is framed as 'anxiety' and 'greed'—maladjustments to empire rather than spiritual death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'recruitment' narrative. It attempts to move the hearer from one Subject-role (Producer) to another (Mercy-bearer), but God remains a background Sender/Helper rather than the lead Actor.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one who must 'quit,' 'stop,' and 'start.'
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the subject of the 'returning.'
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Return to your roots,' use 'God is fetching you back to your roots.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the productive fig tree.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer as the thirsty one who has NO money, emphasizing total passivity in receiving the wine/milk.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how God's pardon actually *enables* the change that the empire's anxiety prevents.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Empire as a spiritual bondage that we cannot escape by 'new resolve.'
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make the 'free gift' truly necessary rather than just a better option.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (bearing fruit) is threatening to swallow Soteriology (pardon).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Establish the Pardon as an accomplished fact that *necessarily* produces fruit, rather than a conditional reward.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a beautiful rhetorical flow and captures the cultural tension well, but it risks turning 'Grace' into a new item on the 'To-Do' list.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is persuasive and 'winsome.' Actantially, it is a heavy burden on the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis identifies the 'free' nature of Isaiah 55, but the narrative structure imposes a 'unless you repent' conditionality from Luke.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the word 'free' appearing 7 times, the Hearer is the Subject of 70% of the active verbs, making it a sermon of Law.

appendices.notities: The use of the AT&T ad creates a strong cultural frame that dominates the biblical actants.
